bibl.title: Letter from Leandro M. Tocantins to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952

div1.p: Tocantins informs Hench that he will represent Jefferson Medical College at the Camp Lazear dedication. Hench is invited to the Pan-American Medical Association meeting which will meet on December 5 to report on the events and to highlight the accomplishments of Jefferson alumnus Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Leandro M. Tocantins to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952
div1.opener:
THE JEFFERSON MEDICAL COLLEGE OF PHILADELPHIA
1025 WALNUT STREET
November 26, 1952.
Dr. Philip Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have been honored by the designation to represent
Jefferson Medical College at the Inaugural Act of the Park “Campamento
Lazear”, including the historic house where Carlos Finlay worked on his
theory of the mosquito transmission of yellow fever. I was told by Dr.
George Bennett that you shall be present at this affair and I am very
delighted for this opportunity to lend our support to this gesture of
recognition of a distinguished Jefferson Graduate.

On the 5th of December, 1952, it is planned to hold a
similar commemorative meeting of the Pan American Medical Association
in Philadelphia. At this time we hope to bring to light many of the
accomplishments of Carlos Finlay and report on the events that took
place in Cuba on December 3rd. We are very anxious to have you here at
the time and, if it is at all possible, that on your way back to Rochester
you could stop off in Philadelphia, it would please us a great deal and
enhance immeasurably the effectiveness of our meeting. Please wire your
answer collect to the above address. The meeting will be held at 6:30 P.M.
Friday, December 5th.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, L. M. Tocantins, M.D. LMT/mcf
